      • testCountCentrallyManagedFiles

        public void testCountCentrallyManagedFiles()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        1) Create a central config channel (A) add a bunch of files & dirs 2) Call ConfigurationManager.countCentrallyManagedFiles and verify that we have the correct answer 3) Create a new channel and add ONE file thats new and One file duplicate of a file in Channel (A) ... 4) Call ConfigurationManager.countCentrallyManagedFiles and verify that the answer is number of files in Channel A + 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - under exceptional circumstances

      • testCountCentrallyDeployableFiles

        public void testCountCentrallyDeployableFiles()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        1) Create a central config channel (A) add a bunch of files & dirs 2) Call ConfigurationManager.countCentrallyDeployableFiles and verify that we have the correct answer 3) Create a Local channel and add One file duplicate of a file in Channel (A) ... 4) Verify that the NUM_OF_FILES = NUM_OF_FILES - 1 5) Add ONE file thats new to Channel A and store 6) Call ConfigurationManager.countCentrallyManagedFiles and verify that the answer should be = number of files previously in Channel A before step 5 (ie NUM_OF_FILES) num_of_centrally_deployable_files(A) = num_centrally_managed_files (A) - num_of_files( A ^ Local) where ^ = Intersection In the above example num_of_centrally_deployable_files(A) = (NUM_OF_FILES + 1) + NUM_OF_DIRS - 1 = NUM_OF_FILES + NUM_OF_DIRS
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - under exceptional circumstances

      • testCountLocallyManagedFiles

        public void testCountLocallyManagedFiles()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Counts the number of locally managed files... for a given server
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if channel/server creation fails
